summary: Achieve your fitness goals: Strength, cardio & ab workouts at the gym or at home

scraped_reviews.content: It worked well for awhile, but recently it doesn't seem to have a stable connection for Peloton workouts on the guide, bike, or iPad. It'll work for a short while, then the device won't show any heart rate data, and the watch will show my HR is fixed on a number. It looks like I'm not the only one having this problem. I've started using an arm strap HR meter to get a stable connection, as the watch app currently isn't reliable. My watch is a Galaxy watch 7
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for reporting the heart rate tracking issue. This has been resolved in the latest app release, version 3.57. Please update your app to the latest version on your mobile and watch devices.

scraped_reviews.content: Overall the experience with this app on-watch is pretty inconsistent (I have a Pixel Watch 2). Regularly will not connect to my bike or phone, and I know it isn't my watch's fault because the Fitbit workout tracker and heart rate monitors all work fine. The issue only appears when I try to track my heart rate via the Peloton app to get my strive score. The timer on the watch app is also sub-par and regularly gets stuck, so it makes it impossible to track my time while working out.

The app is actually good when it works, but the frequent "Something Went Wrong" messages or alleged network errors when there is literally no network problem, and other apps and browsers work just fine, is simply annoying. Othertimes, it doesn't even log in and you just see a spinning wheel. I am questioning my decision to pay Peloton $50/month on top of the equipment expenses.

Worked well enough for the 30-day return window on my Pixel Watch 3. Now it will not sync the heart rate to my Bike+ during a ride. The app on the watch gets stuck on a static HR number, which is clearly inaccurate, and the indicator on the Bike just spins like there's no connection. Seems to be limited to the Peloton app. Very frustrating.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for reporting the heart rate tracking issue. This has been resolved in the latest app release, version 3.57. Please update your app to the latest version on both your mobile and watch devices.

scraped_reviews.content: Just awful with the random pausing. While running outdoors kills the momentum, even when stretching and the phone is away from me. Paused 25 times in a 10 minute workout. This didn't used to happen. Also for outdoor runs, it ALWAYS stopped tracking GPS and metrics after 20ish minutes (on a 25 or 30 minute run). Very annoying. For $44/month I expect a lot more.

The platform is great. The app is alright. I don't like that if I'm tracking something like a walk, I can't use any of the other app functions. It's also a little glitchy when doing other workouts. If I have a stack lined up, it won't always load the next workout after I complete the first. Or sometimes, shorter classes (warm-ups, stretches that are 5 minutes) don't appear in my history and I'll have to repeat them if I want the credit.

This App is absolutely fantastic! There are so many workouts to choose from. It allows you to choose your level of intensity, workout length and instuctor. It offers every type of workout in one place, from barre, yoga, cardio and on and on. The price is amazingly low for all that you get! Oh, I almost forgot, you can do live workouts too!! Shut up!!

Greedy. $12.99 used to get you unlimited cardio classes, now you're limited to 3/month, and you have to pay $24 for unlimited. That's ridiculous. Nobody is going to pay that much more if they're just using it for some treadmill videos. Overall very poor value for the basic membership, no longer worth it. My girlfriend used this app for a while but is now canceling and seeking an alternative.

App is terrible, compared to the iPhone app. You can do a lot more in the iOS app. On this app hardly get any details, name of workout, kj, and date/time. Seriously? I can't even see distance or calories burned? No heart rate? What's the point? Thankfully I am not the primary user or payer of the bike or I'd be even more unhappy. I am just stunned by the differences in the two app versions. For the price point of the bike and membership, I expect better. Hopefully these features are in the works

I love the cycling classes, but the Android app is such a huge disappointment. I wasn't able to purchase the Peloton bike, so I purchased another bike to use with the app and was led to believe that my bike could still connect to the app to view my cadence, etc. What I didn't know was that this was only true of the iOS version. If you're going to continue to offer less for the Android version, then Android users should also pay less money for the subscription.

The app is really not user friendly. I want to search for a certain program, there is no search option? Also, the classes you sign up for, there's no where to look at what you signed up for in one place so you have to just remember and hope you dont miss it? I'm confused. I also use Openfit and that app is a million times better in terms of easily finding exactly what you want. Edit: I have an iphone for my work phone and downloaded the app on there and it's so much better, how frustrating

The content is really great, but the app itself has been frustrating. The biggest issue is it will crash mid run for no reason. There is also no way to jump to where you left off in the workout so you're forced to start over or go without. It also significantly under records distance when running. Update: the distance calculation is much better and the crashes are much less frequent, but they are still happening.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Marc, thanks for the feedback. Please update to the latest version of the app and let us know if you're still seeing these issues. We've made an update to our distance calculation for outdoor running and expect things to be more accurate.

scraped_reviews.content: Um, notifications? The main draw of an app (in my opinion) is how useful the notifications are. This app has none! I didn't know this until after I missed a class I signed up for. What's the point?? Users should get a notification 5 minutes before the start time to remind them and so they can get to their equipment. That would really make this app the best. Notifications, reminders, general motivation (a class you may like is starting in 30 minutes).

Peloton is a great service, but the Android app needs some serious work. You can browse and launch classes, but get ready for connection drops and endless buffering mid-workout, regardless of your signal strength. And if you do get the Circle of Death, your only option is to fully end the workout and restart it again from zero. No resume function?! I can't give the app zero stars, because it at least runs. But without a stable video player, it's completely worthless for working out. Half a star

Overall love the courses and instructors. Functionality of the app could definitely be better. A quick 15 second rewind button, a better way to rewind back to the start of the last exercise. The other day I got close to finishing a workout, wanted to redo the last set and found that the banner along the bottom for finishing now blocked my ability to rewind. Would love to go into my workouts and click on them and be taken back to their page to restart them (why can't I do that?), Or share.

I just bought a Pelton heart rate monitor. The app crashes every time in the setup process while connecting to my monitor. I can connect via Bluetooth on my phone fine, but not in the app, and without connecting in the app, the app won't recognize my device, so I can't use the device at all. *Update - After troubleshooting with Peloton, they said I need a replacement because it is defective. I called and they will only replace items bought from their own store. They don't stand by their products

Nice App. Good workouts and a good variety. It takes a while to find your favorite instructor, but when you do, it makes the workout fun. The music is overpowered by the instructor's mike, so a lot of times you can't even hear the songs on runs and rides. The music sounds like it's just coming over their computer speakers and caught on the mike rather than a real soundsystem. I would also like the workouts to be filtered by equipment needed, you only find out after you click on the class.

I own the bike and I love it; the app falls short. The app looks nice but gives you no access to any of your ride data. It doesn't connect or track any data from heartrate monitors. If you take a class with video be aware that a 45 min class will be around 2.2GB of data. It seems the app does not detect the connection type to choose lower quality stream. I've had a few instances of freezing or cutting out. This has resulted in strange artifacts like taking two classes at the same time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. Those features are not yet available, but please stay tuned for updates. We've also passed along your feedback to the rest of our team while we work on future improvements. Please contact us at support@onepeloton.com if you have any questions.

scraped_reviews.content: I'm not sure that I'm comfortable with the pricing, but I really have enjoyed the experience & the app worked great. The app offers outdoor/indoor running "classes" which don't really feel like a class. For me, it's been helpful to have music & encouragement in the background. However, if you aren't interested in the encouragement aspect you could simply use a music app or make your own playlist for your workout regime. I really appreciated getting to select music/coaching style.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for sharing your experience with us. We are happy to hear that you are enjoying Peloton Digital, and we have passed along your feedback. Please do not hesitate to contact us at support@onepeloton.com if you have any questions or if there's anything else that we can do to improve your Peloton experience.

scraped_reviews.content: I like this app and the variety of workouts. I've always used it on an Android - based on other reviews, I apparently don't know what I'm missing. I honestly just hate how much the trainers talk. Almost every single one. They play great music but do not stop saying meaningless words the.....entire.....time. Not training/form or here's what's coming up next cues. Just words. It prevents me from escaping into the music and I don't enjoy the workout.

I can't really rate the classes because I only got to take one. Every time after that, the app gave me a "Network Error" message and wouldn't play any classes. I have never had problems streaming other services and I am fairly tech savvy. I tried to troubleshoot but realized I was wasting my entire workout time messing with it, so I moved on to another app that did work. I was ready to subscribe, but good thing I got a trial period to see it wasn't going to work, so I didn't waste any money.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry for the issue you're experiencing. Should you continue to experience any issues, please reach out to us at support@onepeloton.com and we'll be more than happy to assist you.

scraped_reviews.content: Are they kidding? They've been supposedly working on this app for at least a year (most likely more), and while it has nice UI, it's missing even basic functionality. You can't see your workout history in detail like you can on the bike. No Chromecast ability! Seriously? There are strength, yoga, and stretching classes on here, and there's no way to play it on your TV? This is critical flaw. App shouldn't have been released without this. Can't leave feedback. What a joke.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. We are sorry to hear that you are not happy with Digital for Android. We have passed along your feedback to the rest of our team for consideration as we are working on future improvements. Please don't hesitate to reach out to support@onepeloton.com if you have any questions.

scraped_reviews.content: Great, instructive videos! I love having music playing while the instructor talks through a workout. One thing I would critque is the ease in finding the right level workout. I wish it were easier to see the level more easily when picking a run, strength workout, etc. Other than that - I love it! Great, encouraging workouts with fun music in the background.

Overall I love having this app. It would be really helpful to be able to recommend classes to others, particularly to other users under our account. For example, I would greatly appreciate being able to recommend classes to my parents to help them more easily access classes. This way when they open their profiles they see classes I've recommended. I think the classes are easily accessible, but the fewer steps the better in order to help keep them moving. Thanks!

Buffering ruins this app. The classes are great, but there's more buffering time than there is class time. Services like Netflix, Amazon prime, and Hulu play fine on my wifi, but Peloton is horrible. Even on the rare occasion when it buffers only once a minute instead of multiple times a minute, the audio is off from the visual, which is weird for weights classes.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We are sorry you are experiencing buffering. Please reach out to us via live chat and we will be more than happy to assist you with getting this resolved.

scraped_reviews.content: I would be happier with the Android app if it had the same functions as the iPad one, I'm not sure why finding friends is only available on the iOS version, but it's a little disappointing. The Android version also has more trouble connecting with my Keiser bike where the iOS version does not. Otherwise, I love the classes and the tracking and the connections, it makes working out so fun and adds a ton of challenge and variety to my routine!

Good not Great. I like the live stuff and some of the workouts. It drives me crazy that their are no rundowns of what excercises will all be included in the workout. Yes, you do have a brief explanation but no actual list of excercises. It would make it easier to pick which Bootcamps or Strength workouts I want to do as well as helping me be prepared to modify something if needed. Also, a way to download the workout so I can play it off line if needed. Some places I go dont have great wifi.

Blocks apps like LastPass and pasting long, secure passwords. Welcome to 2002! Not a good first impression. With no Chromecast support, I'm not sure how useful this app really is. No idea what they were thinking with that decision, especially these days where you have to go out of your way to not support Chromecast on Android. For those of you with the Google Home app and certain phones, it's possible to just cast your screen to the Chromecast to get around Pelotons incompetence.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We are sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with your Peloton experience. We have passed along your request to the rest of our team for consideration. Please feel free to contact us at support@onepeloton.com if you have any questions or need assistance with anything.

scraped_reviews.content: The difference in workout information between the Android and Apple platforms is ridiculous! After a workout I wanted to look at my info. All the Android app shows is the kj # which is useless for transferring to other health apps. Apple app provides per workout distance, calories, effort output; all the info you need for health apps. Considering these are the same complaints from a year ago, the Android team has clearly put 0 effort into fixing this app.

7/28/2023... Ever since the pricing tiers changed, I can no longer use the "view details" in the workouts to see what exercises are in the workout. Also, I have to close the app between each workout or it won't let me do another workout - it just keeps going back to the home page. I have the full subscription, so there's no reason for this as far as what version of the app I have. It's just been so glitchy ever since you introduced pricing tiers.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We apologize for the inconvenience. Should you continue to experience buffering, please reach out to our team at support@onepeloton.com and we can assist you.

scraped_reviews.content: I travel for work and thought this app would be a great way to keep up with my workout routine, particularly in inclement weather. I was really impressed by the bike after riding it at a hotel. I was wrong, you need a high speed internet connection for it to work. If the internet is a little slow, this app is useless. It also doesn't log any of your workout stats and there is no way to enter them manually if you recorded them with another device.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We are sorry to hear that you're not happy with your Digital experience. We have noted your feedback and shared it with the rest of our team. Please feel free to reach out to us at support@onepeloton.com if you have any questions or if there is anything that we can do to improve your experience.

scraped_reviews.content: Love it but I have both an Android & iPhone. There are different features on each. iPhone I can rate the class after the workout but my search features aren't as good. On the Android, I can search by weights/ no weights.. there's just more search features on the Android. If you actually have a Peloton bike you can search by specific bands which I wish they offered on the phone app. It's a good app,great workouts I just wish they had all the search features on both mobile apps

Casting ability does not work & shouldn't have been such a long time coming. Confirmed it's not a TV or phone problem. It is most definitely a Peloton problem. For a paid subscription app, many features are missing that are standard, like having multiple playlists/stacks, multiple collections of bookmarks, seamless casting to other devices, etc. Finding the type of class isn't as intitutive as needed. However it's the only way I like to work out so I'm stuck with it for better or for worse.

Let's get this straight. Someone spends $2K on a $200 bike and then the manufacturer wants $20 a month additional for using their app?! That's right, you have to pay to be able to access anything on this app. This has to be one of the biggest rip offs I've ever seen. My advice, get a $200-300 bike on Amazon, use your phone or tablet and watch FREE videos on YouTube. Can't believe there are that many clueless people out there (well yes I can actually)?!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We apologize for any confusion. The Digital subscription is included in the $39/month Bike subscription. Therefore, you can access Digital for free by logging into your Peloton account that is linked to the Bike. Should you have any questions or are experiencing any issues, please contact us at support@onepeloton.com.

scraped_reviews.content: Freezes when streaming via Chromecast and we have gigabit speeds here. Getting a bit ticked off that we spend $40 a month for this *UPDATE* some ideas to make the app better. Add the ability to see more details on classes. ie the class difficulty rating would be great. Also would love to see Dance classes added as a whole for people like my wife. Lastly, to be able to see your followers and those you're following in the app would be good. To have the bike experience on the app would be best.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We apologize for the inconvenience. Chromecast buffering is an identified issue and our team is working to get it resolved as soon as possible. We have also passed along your requests, including more details on classes and viewing your followers. Please feel free to reach out to us at support@onepeloton.com if there is anything we can do to assist.

scraped_reviews.content: Had a few issues at first but the app is great. Like the classes and ability to filter to find what I want. Even though Spin is their bread and butter, they do have great variety of other fitness options. Like that there is a variety of live and pre-recorded sessions. Really appreciate the variety and diversity of instructors. This has been a great substitute for not being able to workout in the gym.

The app is really good if you are traveling. It doesn't sync well with your bike. I can't look up my detailed stats at all and it won't sync with Garmin. Really important that these issues be fixed to create a more comprehensive experience. The fact that I can't pull up my individual rides and review stats is not acceptable. Also, you can't approve connection requests on the app. Only in the bike.

Love that there's so much variety across the types of workouts, instructors, difficulty levels and music types. Some instructors are really uplifting, some have a more humorous approach, some are really positive but still kick your butt- generally they're all really great. I have favorites ðŸ˜‚. It's fun and great for at-home workouts. I downloaded during Quarantine, and will probably end up subscribing after my trial ends lol. I just wish you could share workouts with other subscribers

I like the variety of workouts and the fact that I can do them from my home. My treadmill isn't a Peloton tread, but it works just fine for this. I also enjoy the yoga, strength training, and meditations. I love that I can pick a different workout every day. I often use the filter feature to search for workouts I'd like to do. The only thing I'd like to see improved would be the ability to add notes or ratings to workouts I've done so i can remember ones I liked or that were too hard.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We are happy to hear that you are enjoying your Digital experience and are taking full advantage of all that we have to offer. We have passed along your request to the rest of our team. Please feel free to reach out to us at support@onepeloton.com if you have any questions.

scraped_reviews.content: I wish the casting function actually worked. I've watched the same video on the same wifi on my phone without problems abd can cast other apps without issue, but the cast function causes jumps back 30 seconds frequently enough that it makes it difficult to finish the workouts. The workouts themselves are great, other than not always giving enough description of the move.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are very sorry for the issue you are experiencing. Please reach out to us at support@onepeloton.com and we will be more than happy to assist you.

scraped_reviews.content: I really like the classes but the Android app is far inferior to the iOS version. Many options are not available and there is no way to download (preload) the classes. Update: The buffering is terrible! There is nothing worse than being in a tabata workout and then have buffering during the exertion phase. Please fix. Maybe give us the option to reduce the resolution, similar to other streaming services.

Used the app for 2 weeks and like it very much. I do not have a Peloton so only utilize the non-cycle and low weight classes. App has a good variety of classes from yoga, meditation, strength, HIIT etc. Live and recorded both options available. Only feature I would recommend is to be able to create a workout plan/ Playlist of different classes

Data hog.... only use this app if you have unlimited data. I downloaded this app after watching their ads on tv. I started the free trial and fully admit I love the classes I took. I took three 20 minute fun runs and loved them (and I hate running). i had the app loaded onto my phone for a little over a week and took those 3 classes. I was horrified to see the app used almost 4G of data in that time. I do not have an unlimited plan, so that is really going to cost me... for a free trial.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the classes on Digital. We have passed along your feedback regarding downloading classes. Please do not hesitate to reach out to us at support@onepeloton.com if you have any questions or if there is anything else that we can do to improve your Peloton experience.

scraped_reviews.content: Overall a great app but some instructors need major training. Especially in yoga. There are so many instructors who waste time explaining things while we are in a stand by position which disrupts the whole flow of the workout. There are numerous times when i'm stretching one side so much longer due to this "explaining" phase. It annoys me so much that I had to stop the practice and just use another app or do my own.

Great app! Using it with an alternative spin bike (not a peleton). I love the very large number of classes available in addition to the live classes. Also love the availability of non-cycling workouts! One feature not available on my Android that is available on my wife's iPhone app is the ability to synch my cadence meter into the app. I would have given 5 stars if this was available for Android.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for sharing your experience with us. We're happy to hear that you're enjoying the classes. We have passed along your feedback to the rest of our team. Please feel free to contact us at support@onepeloton.com if you have any questions or need assistance with anything.

scraped_reviews.content: One star for one simple reason: I pay the same as other users, but because I use Android I don't get the same features when I use the app on my mobile. When I subscribed by digital, alone, this was true. And now that I own a bike (and have for almost a year) it is also true. Peloton does not give me a discount for a digital subscription, or a discount for my recurring subscription with the bike, despite the fact that they choose to leave significant features out of the Android app. Until Peloton chooses to treat all their customers equally, I'll need to continue to review this poorly.

I don't currently have a Peloton bike or Tread, but I love being able to take classes on my own wherever I'm at. They have so many different categories (strength, yoga, cardio, meditation, etc). The instructor are really fun and engaging. Only thing I wish is that they would have a search function for their classes. You can filter on length of class, instructor, the type of music, etc. I like that they have different short classes you can take solo or stack together.

It's a great app, I love using it for other workouts not on the bike. During the day it's nice to do a quick meditation to recenter yourself for the day. I do wish there was an easier way to rate the classes after you're done with them, as I feel I can only do this on the bike/treadmill. Also I wish I could add and follow people on the app. But overall I'm here for the workouts, and the stream quality is great and the value of this system is top notch.

I enjoy the app but the Anroid version is not as interactive as I'd like. For instance, I can't redo a workout by clicking on any of the completed workouts in my profile. There's also no way on anroid to interact with other Peloton members or download a class. It would appear that iOS is a completely different and more engaging app. But the instructors and classes are great!

Android App offers almost nothing for users who are looking to take their exercise outside. There are no metrics offered and no GPS tracking. This app is essentially only good for confirming that you did an exercise at one point (as long as you don't want to see any of the stats). Pretty upsetting that Android users pay the same price but get zero of the features iPhone users get.

title: KAYAK: Flights, Hotels & Cars
description: KAYAK searches hundreds of travel sites to show you your options and let you pick what works best for your trip. Track prices, set a budget, build your itinerary and more.Â  Whatâ€™s in our app. Find, compare & book flights, hotels and car rental with KAYAKâ€™s travel app. Get the flight you want: Compare flight options from hundreds of sites then zero in on the best one for you by using our filters.Â  Hotel rates only on the app: Find mobile-only prices from select hotels. Car sharing: Search car sharing alongside traditional agencies for more options (and maybe better prices). Know when prices change: Track search results for your trip and get a notification when prices change. Search on your budget: Only have $300 to spend? KAYAK Explore will show you your flight options, on any budget. Only on the KAYAK App. Flight tracker: Get alerts when something about your flight changes or track flights so you can see if youâ€™ll make your connection. Trips offline: All your ticket confirmations and reservations loaded into Trips are accessible regardless of whether or not you have Wifi. Measure your bag: Direct your camera at your bag or carry on and weâ€™ll let you know if itâ€™s the right size for your flight without incurring a fee. We love feedback. Got a question and in need of support? Send us a message at https://www.kayak.com/help and weâ€™ll help you out. More on what KAYAK offers. Find flights, hotels, vacation rentals, rental cars and more - then filter by what matters to you most. Like a pet-friendly boutique hotel with a pool. Or a 4-door sedan with airport pick-up to get you on your way. We bring together great deals from your favorite travel sites in one place.Â  Search hundreds of flight sites at once. With filtering and flexibility options, you can quickly search and book what works best for your trip.Â  More options, more saving. Find mobile-only rates and exclusive deals on the app. Set Price Alerts to know when prices drop on the flights, cars and hotels youâ€™re interested in. Create itineraries as you plan. Our Trips tool puts all your plans in one place. Get alerted to flight and gate changes, access boarding passes both on- and offline, and share your itinerary with friends â€“ all in one spot. You can sync your inbox or manually add any part of your trip - from tour and restaurant confirmations to notes on things to see. Car rental deals. Search from over 70,000 locations to find the perfect rental car. Book risk-free by filtering for free cancellation policies. Get a hotelâ€¦ or a home. See your accommodation options from major hotel chains and resorts to local boutiques to apartments, cabins, beach homes and more. Filter for free cancellation if youâ€™re worried plans will change. Plan your next trip with KAYAK. Download now to start planning a great trip.

KAYAK searches hundreds of travel sites to show you your options and let you pick what works best for your trip. Track prices, set a budget, build your itinerary and more.Â 



Whatâ€™s in our app.

Find, compare & book flights, hotels and car rental with KAYAKâ€™s travel app.

Get the flight you want: Compare flight options from hundreds of sites then zero in on the best one for you by using our filters.Â 

Hotel rates only on the app: Find mobile-only prices from select hotels.

Car sharing: Search car sharing alongside traditional agencies for more options (and maybe better prices).

Know when prices change: Track search results for your trip and get a notification when prices change.

Search on your budget: Only have $300 to spend? KAYAK Explore will show you your flight options, on any budget.



Only on the KAYAK App.

Flight tracker: Get alerts when something about your flight changes or track flights so you can see if youâ€™ll make your connection.

Trips offline: All your ticket confirmations and reservations loaded into Trips are accessible regardless of whether or not you have Wifi.

Measure your bag: Direct your camera at your bag or carry on and weâ€™ll let you know if itâ€™s the right size for your flight without incurring a fee.



We love feedback.

Got a question and in need of support? Send us a message at https://www.kayak.com/help and weâ€™ll help you out.



More on what KAYAK offers.

Find flights, hotels, vacation rentals, rental cars and more - then filter by what matters to you most. Like a pet-friendly boutique hotel with a pool. Or a 4-door sedan with airport pick-up to get you on your way. We bring together great deals from your favorite travel sites in one place.Â 



Search hundreds of flight sites at once.

With filtering and flexibility options, you can quickly search and book what works best for your trip.Â

Create itineraries as you plan.

Our Trips tool puts all your plans in one place. Get alerted to flight and gate changes, access boarding passes both on- and offline, and share your itinerary with friends â€“ all in one spot. You can sync your inbox or manually add any part of your trip - from tour and restaurant confirmations to notes on things to see.



Car rental deals.

Get a hotelâ€¦ or a home.
