scraped_reviews.content: The app was usable, functional, and effective. Then they "updated" it and the appearance changed. Now I have to click click click to get to the documents I want, which used to be accessible every time I opened the app. Sorry but not everyone wants to chat with AI, search for what should be right there, or create a project. Miserable fail.

I absolutely despise how it automatically opens to the copilot chat every time. I'm using this app so that I can access my files on my phone, not to talk to some robot. Completely inaccessible and frustrating to useâ€”and once I finally do figure out how to get to files, which is under "search" for some reason, it takes at least 15 minutes of syncing time to open anything. I don't know why I bother.

I use it to sync my work between my laptop, phone, and tablet. It is amazing when it works. However, I have begun having issues over the last year with the app on my phone and tablet not syncing updated work. No matter how many times you force a sync, it will not pull in any docs. (And yes, I did check for updates each time, and there were none) The only solution I've found thus far is to completely remove the app and re-download it. After that, there are no more issues.

The app is so bad. It keeps getting worse. I used to be able to convert a photo to a pdf by opening the photo to Microsoft copilot, but now it just takes me to the chat. If I try to upload it directly from copilot and select the photo I want to convert, it allows me to edit, but when I click "finish," it takes me back to copilot without saving. I tried the same one twice, and it didn't save either time. Completely unusable.

This app is effectively supposed to be a replacement for the individual office apps they used to have. On most counts, this is an upgrade. However, that's assuming you can ever get a document to load. I have no idea what happened, but it takes a solid 5 minutes for something to load in this that used to effectively be instantaneous with the old app. it makes no sense whatsoever. This really needs to be reoptimized, or something needs to be fixed.

All my programs constantly crash (excel, word) all the time now in the middle of my work, and you significantly raised prices at the same time. Kind of lame you can't have a good product and this AI is not helping and probably part of issue. Go back to the basics and charge the old price we all don't need or want these changes! Your affecting my job and efficiency in a very bad way!

I hate that I'm forced to use this. I used to be able to do everything with the Teams app. Now I have to use this and it doesn't work. I can't do over half what I could before without getting yet another app, which still doesn't work. This one mostly worked around a year ago, but recently it literally can't do anything. It crashes, makes me sign in 5 times per document, etc. Incredibly, this app is even worse on the computer! On the computer, almost impossible. Not to mention the AI garbage!

Every since downloading this app, I've been having issues opening documents. It will launch after downloading but I get the main screen that only shows M365 with logo? Also, after I've downloaded documents they're kept in a location I can't find in MyFiles? Once I was able to locate them but no offer to remove or delete them after hovering & right clicking. Not very helpful.

It got one because I couldn't give less. 90 minutes trying to edit ONE paragraph and place it. Still never got done. I can tell the programmer was one of those types that when faced with a problem would say, "Just can't do it Mom, but I'll bet the print shop is still open! yeah ..take it there". This is MICROSOFT? I expected better. I expected SOMETHING. But instead of freeing up some time, I had to divert it, to be sure this thing didn't eat my work! Don't sweat your jobs. Locked out now (lol)

DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE. I recommend that you follow copilots advice and switch to a competitors app. It's far lacking from any previous versions of Microsoft office programs that you have used in the past. Having removed single point access in favor of having to download multiple apps to have full functionality and access to your subscription. Copilot hinders access and will take you out of your file any time you save it. So whatever you do don't save your work because you will lose it.

I need this app to open MS365 files on my phone. If I wanted Copilot, I would have installed the separate Copilot app. Instead, the whole app has been transformed to be Copilot, and the actual documents have been hidden away under Search â€“ which you wouldn't expect. I've been using OneDrive to actually access my documents, but still rely on this to edit those files. Just put Copilot into a button, and let us use 365/Office properly again!

For the past month, the app has been unstable and crashes frequently. Right while I'm in the middle of writing. I'm not doing anything extreme with it at all. No formatting, no tables, nothing - except entering letters and it randomly crashes every few minutes. And unless I save what I'm doing manually, I lose whatever has not been auto saved. MS, help?

Long term subscriber now cancelled and moved to another app which is actually more expensive. so that tells you how bad it's been for me. Each update gets worse on my device. I can't directly scan photos because it now cuts them off since a few updates back. I get advert banners despite being a paid subscriber on android, but not ipad. However ipad keeps crashing. More than once I have spent hours on a document to get to the end and it's lost. I don't find the Ai to be as good as another I use.

Crashed multiple times when Word is used. I was using Word to take a note during my experiment, but it always closes itself now and then, that made me to save my progress periodically by going out and in of application multiple times just to avoid my progress loses when the crashes happen again. Disappointing, given that this app is supposed to be a flagship app. And not to mention we need to subscribe to it.

M365 copilot redesign is awful. I just want to access my office files. In order to find files now, I have to click the three line menu button, then go to create (bad name), then click the folder button. Then, I have to scroll through a huge list of files because there is no way to search or sort them in any way. The file I always need to access is 100+ spots down the page because supposedly I haven't edited it in a year, despite editing it an hour ago. Terrible job Microsoft. Copilot is bad.

While the app works well with having an easy-to-use interface for Word, Iâ€™m experiencing repeated text corruption when typing with both software and hardware keyboards on Android (Samsung Galaxy S9+ tablet and Samsung Galaxy s24+ phone). Words are being overwritten or mashed together in the Microsoft 365 app. I've tested multiple keyboards (Gboard, Simple Keyboard, Samsung Keyboard) with the same issue. Please fix this input handling bug ASAP.

Microsoft 365 combined Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and more all in one platform. There are no significant bugs I am experiencing when using the application. The application is quite excellent in my opinion. I absolutely hope new features will continue to be added that improves and enhances Microsoft 365. Well done Microsoft!

Pain in the rear end. Try to sign in, and I get "Trying to sign you in from another app. Please try again later." I DON'T WANT to stay signed in. This inability to sign in easily frequently makes me use another app. I don't want every single document I view to be put in the cloud. But I also don't want to this major hassle every single time I do try to use it.

Won't sync. Very annoying. No matter how often I save my document from my desk top copilot only wants to open a version of the file from 3 months ago. Although the app works for some things, this makes it a lot less useful and a lot more frustrating. From 5 stars to 2. Please fix, I really appreciated being able to access my files remotely.

Utter clown show. Microsoft continue to make their offering worse, less reliable, and less professional through the compulsory addition of poorly implemented and just plain broken AI features. It has gotten to the point that correcting AI mistakes and finding workarounds has become a significant impediment to just doing my job. At every opportunity I'm choosing to work in alternative products.

I wish I knew how to use everything . Why doesn't my Microsoft 365 copilot start after I've logged in on my Android? I've had nothing but problems with all Microsoft apps. I've reached out to yoir customer service 20 times. I've filled.out forms and still Noone gets back to me.. I.pay $14.00.a .month now. I've been a paying client for almost 6 years. help.me!!!!!

I don't like being FORCED into things. And being forced into AI, Is big No to me. Already working on trying to transfer documents from one drive to close accounts with microsoft. However they don't make it easy for someone who doesn't own a computer. Mobile devices are all I have and I can't move anything from OneDrive not even through the Internet. Another good reason to drop Microsoft.

Glitchy lately. Will pull up a blank screen when opening a PDF. Will keep new Word docs "read only" even though my subscription automatically permits editing. Deleted, reinstalled, tried a forced stop. Going to keep trying. I used to use the app daily; but if it isn't working, I may drop my subscription and switch to Google. I don't want to.

Used to work well but lately always asks me to sign in. Or tells me I can't edit with this account despite being a M365 subscriber and also being logged into two work accounts. Doesn't download the latest version of documents despite saying download recent changes. Please fix basic issues before adding unwanted stuff like AI. And just call it Office already and stop renaming for no reason.

Productivity gets better with time and expanded integrations. There is a reason Microsoft is and has been the business productivity go-to for decades. I've used Copilot since its prominence gained traction, before it was folded into the whole Microsoft Office ecosystem. I found the integration improved user's workflow, but always promote not taking the easy way out, and to use your own creativity as a base starting point. The possibilities are limitless.

Microsoft 365(Office) is very beneficial for any organisation network, completely for any studies through reading and well deserved to be used in every household, especially the next generation with the opportunity to achieve the necessary information in place. So I recommend to any work situation and recognise it is easy access trust you will be able to save time downloading and believe you will see results in your plans to adapt in any way possible. Including yearly payments, very affordable.

The App is not user-friendly to people with visual impairment, especially those who depend on screen readers such as TalkBack to open and read Word documents. It usually fails to open, create and edit Word documents when the screen reader accessibility is on. I liked it very much before but I cannot tolerate such a problem any more without reporting. Unless it is resolved, the App is becoming very unfriendly.

I downloaded this and within a week, despite me not using it more than once, somehow someone gained access to my account. What a coincidence! Oh, and Microsoft was nice enough to wait 6 hours before notifying me off the compromise, as shown by the recent activity. And what's up with it taking up to 24h to logout of all devices for my security?! Thanks to this app, I may be getting rid of every Microsoft service going forward.

Since the update a month or so ago, I've lost all my my notes within the app, and since then I couldn't get them back. The app used to have notes tab before the update, but after that, the notes tab disappeared, I downloaded the Microsoft one note app to check on it, But there wasn't anything, then I tried to login to my account which had all the data, and all the data just got deleted. So now I want all my lost notes back, please, that was the data of 4 years or more... Thanks

I don't like the copilot, it doesn't make things easier, it makes it more frustrating, and harder to find files, etc. I'm thinking about cancelling the subscription because of it, I don't know why you can't just have the copilot as another app in the Microsoft 365 app. It also comes up with the subscription run out, when it has and I am still paying for it.

This app used to be a really useful place to access my files from across the Microsoft ecosystem (excel, word etc.) but in the name of AI I don't want Microsoft has made the ridiculous decision to update this app making it just copilot and nothing else! From a great experience to utterly useless, and making it an update to keep all the good reviews. Now it seems if I want my files I need to go back to using the individual apps again, a huge step backwards.

Pure, unadulterated, rubbish! Ever since the "Co pilot" update i can't find anything, I can't navigate, if I ask the stupid ai a question about the app, where to find my files(there's no indication on the opening page) or anything else it comes up with no answer or gibberish!? I liked 365 when it was a useful interface for getting things done. Now it's just a wasted icon on my phone, soon to be deleted and my subscription canceled.

Edit. Notes have now completely disappeared! I have lost things I need! Give me them back. Pleeeeaaaase! Generally good but the autosave does not always work, so you lose changes, especially in Excel Update. An urgent issue has arisen following the update to copilot. My notes now often don't load. When they do I don't seem to be able to open them or edit them. Please fix this urgently or give me the old 365 back

Used to work, now it doesn't. Initially it worked great. I have a ton of documents created that I now can no longer access. It has somehow linked to an old windows account, and will not give me the option of selecting my current one. I have uninstall and re installed multiple times and when it gets to the sign in screen, it says searching for accounts, then I get blank screen.

Utterly atrocious and incredibly annoying. No, I don't want a stupid notification telling me about the file I already know about. No, I don't want you to close my document after 0.5 seconds of me being in another window. no, i don't want to have to sign in. I downloaded a free alternative, and guess what? I can open the app and then open a file. I'm not notified later or forced to sign in. Microsoft's sole goal is to make increasingly dogshit products, as is evidenced by this garbage app.

Look, I liked the original apps, before it was merged into Copilot. I never lost work when typing on my phone, it never just randomly closed on me for no reason, syncs never failed across documents. Then Copilot existed, and while I liked the ease of access in one place, that was it, everything else got worse. Now, with the latest update, instead of it going straight to your recent documents, it goes to a stupid AI chatbot? WHY??? What possible purpose could I have for that thing?

After the recent update, I am unable to find or access the notes that were previously saved within the app. The earlier version had a dedicated section for notes, which was very convenient and useful. It would be greatly appreciated if you could restore this feature or guide users on how to access their saved notes in the new version. Many users, including myself, rely on these notes for daily tasks and important information.

UI ruined by intrusive AI - this has just had the worst UI update I have ever seen. On the home page links to recent files and applications has been replaced by a pointless Copilot prompt. I just want to quickly open what I was last working on, not have to hunt through menus with multiple clicks to find it. The AI cannot be disabled in preferences.

Whenever I open the excel app in this program I get a stupid message saying "one or more of your accounts want you to sign back in", which is really annoying because I only have one account. I just can't seem to get around this issue, so I'm going to stop using it on my mobile phone.

Efficiency, great collaboration, easy to use, flexible, smart. The copilot works so well, especially with tedious apps like Excel, that I barely use my laptop anymore. The convenience of working on the move, wherever whenever, just makes the experience all the more greater.

I couldn't open an Excel doc sent by a friend. 365/Excel kept showing a pop up box: "Use Microsoft 365 connected experiences". This doesn't happen if I want to open Word/PDF using 365. Apparently on the 365, you have to click the three-bar on the top-left, click Settings next to your account pic, click Privacy, turn ON the d*mn TWO options on the Connected Experiences section!! It doesn't matter if you have a separate Excel app, unusable and back to that pop up box because of the 365 app!!

Overall a fairly decent app. I'm REALLY disappointed that the Sticky Notes were removed. They are still accessible IF you use the Microsoft Launcher, but they don't sync reliably there. I use them heavily for notes between phone and desktop, and now there's no really reliable way to use them on Android. I wish Microsoft would release a stand-alone Sticky Notes app.

Hey, I have been using Microsoft 365 for over 3 years now but you guys have hidden the most important feature in the app! It was easier to nav to my sticky notes on my phone but now I can't find them anymore so I have to rely on my pc! It was convenient but it's not. I am so disappointed man even some features like converting PDFs are to available with the premium to access.

A few years ago I installed Microsoft Office. Recently I noticed that somehow it turned into Copilot which can still open documents and OneDrive was installed automatically. I have no idea what may happen next. Decided to replace it with open source alternatives because I rarely use office on my phone anyway and alternatives are improving.

Will not even log in. I have a new phone. apparently, this app is the only going that opens PDFs. when I've tried to open it, I select "login" and it simply spins. It never logs in. I can't use it. I uninstalled and reinstalled, and it did the same thing. This app is less than worthless for me.

I don't even know how to start this because the situation is just baffling. I LOVED what the office app was initially on mobile: just a way to access office on mobile. That's all it has to be and should be. Keep it modern and running smoothly and that's all. Why on this Earth has it become another Copilot App? We don't like the AI Slop, but even if someone does (good on them) THEY HAVE AN APP FOR IT! There's no reason for it to be this difficult for me to use the app to open and edit documents.

This app is absurd at this point. I got when they changed the name, marketing, right ? But when the functionality is no longer there... I can't scan documents and save, can't see my favorite documents, can browse folders. Unsubscribing honnestly. I DO JOT CSRE ABOUT YOUR AI THING. I DO NOT WANT TO USE IT.

This app has made my phone completely crash out 5 times now. Genshin Impact, which I have been playing since 2020, has never made my phone completely freeze up and refuse to respond to anything, but THIS app, which is supposed to just be a productivity app, has done that 5 times. Whatever the programmers Microsoft hired are doing back there, it's not anything good.

I just want to look at Excel documents. I don't care nor have time to sign into whatever outlook thing you force me to go through. I just want to look at the document. Simplify! I'm sick of sign ins and verification processes and other time wasting nonsense.

Used to be a pretty nice application to access and create files in combination with your Office 365 subscription and storage. Has become an unwanted chat tool which nobody has asked for. These kind of product changes make me go actively look for alternatives and more 'stable' solutions and cancel our families subscriptions.

title: CDisplayEx Comic Reader
description:
CDisplayEx is a light, efficient CBR Reader, and it is also the most popular comic book reader. It is able to read all comic book formats (.cbr file, .cbz, .pdf, etc..) and Manga. Everything is designed to give you the best reading experience, it load comic books immediately, reading is fluid and comfortable.

Please note that access to Google Drive requires the application to pass a CASA Level 3 Assessment. The cost of this certification no longer allows access to Google Drive. The link will remain available until June 15 for those who are not already blocked. After this date, access to Google Drive will be removed from the application.

Benefits of the Pro version:
- Access to  Onedrive, Dropbox, Komga, Kavita, Mega.
- Continuous pages, horizontal and vertical.
- Advanced page scaling options that allow you to pre-set the number of moves to reach the opposite edge of the page.
- Open the files on the network without downloading them entirely (samba).
- Image export function.
- Support for bookmarks.
- S-Pen support.
- Night mode.
- Change the interface language.
- No ads.

You can simply browse through your folders to find and read your comics, but if you need, the management of your library is integrated! simply indicate where your comics are, and the reader will group the comics by series or offer you the next album to read in your collection. An integrated search will allow you to find a volume instantly.

The reader also allows you to connect to network shares, preload files on your phone or tablet, and perform searches.
descriptionHTML:
CDisplayEx is a light, efficient CBR Reader, and it is also the most popular comic book reader. It is able to read all comic book formats (.cbr file, .cbz, .pdf, etc..) and Manga. Everything is designed to give you the best reading experience, it load comic books immediately, reading is fluid and comfortable.

Please note that access to Google Drive requires the application to pass a CASA Level 3 Assessment. The cost of this certification no longer allows access to Google Drive. The link will remain available until June 15 for those who are not already blocked. After this date, access to Google Drive will be removed from the application.

Benefits of the Pro version:
- Access to Onedrive, Dropbox, Komga, Kavita, Mega.
- Continuous pages, horizontal and vertical.
- Advanced page scaling options that allow you to pre-set the number of moves to reach the opposite edge of the page.
- Open the files on the network without downloading them entirely (samba).
- Image export function.
- Support for bookmarks.
- S-Pen support.
- Night mode.
- Change the interface language.
- No ads.

You can simply browse through your folders to find and read your comics, but if you need, the management of your library is integrated! simply indicate where your comics are, and the reader will group the comics by series or offer you the next album to read in your collection. An integrated search will allow you to find a volume instantly.

The reader also allows you to connect to network shares, preload files on your phone or tablet, and perform searches.
summary: The most popular comic book reader.

scraped_reviews.content: After trying multiple comic reading apps (all of which had their own pros), this app has been the best overall, with the most features that I find beneficial. Even the free version is great. The only issue I have is that I cant connect it to my Google Drive, but that isn't even the apps fault since Google is the one that restricted access.

This app has all the features you would want literally two taps away. Reading a comic left to right? Easy. Reading a manga left to right? No problem! You can swipe through the pages vertically, horizontally or even scroll infinitely like a webtoon. You can even adjust the colors of your comics. Not to mention it supports almost every format a comic might be in. Even folders full of images!! TL;DR This is the best comic reader on Android coded by people who must read all kinds of digital comics.

A good app for reading comics on an Android device. It can access a file server but I've found it simpler to just store my comics on an sd card. The interface has an issue scroll bar (quickly scrub to any page), page previews, and issue skip buttons. File navigator could have better button placement but it works ok. A couple of sorting options are available but I've found it's better to just sort the files manually in the folders before I access them with the app.

Well worth the money for the paid version. Ads on the free version make it unusable. Just use the free version to try it out. Don't plan on using it for good. I spent a lot of time looking for a good reader for cbz/cbr files and this is it. One minor suggestion is I wish there were a way to display folder names on top of thumbnail images, specifically for folders. I like being able to customize thumbnail images, but I'd like to see the folder names as well in the grid format. Not the list view.

It's not terrible, though I don't really feel like it's worth $6. This should be classified as a Beta app at best, due to the fact that a lot of features aren't even included. While I like the 'library' feature, which the PC version doesn't seem to have, and is something that makes it a worthy counterpart to other PC software such as Cover or ComicRack, the inability to bookmark sections in comics to read later is a bit of an oversight, so I had to retract a star. But solid nonetheless!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, I invite you to test version 1.3 which brings many improvements including bookmarks. A long press on the thumbnails allows you to add or remove a bookmark. The list of bookmarks appears in the progress bar.

scraped_reviews.content: Update: This is the best android comic/manga reader out there, I looked. But thats not actually saying too much because the others aren't good at all. It does what it suppose to. You're gonna run into frustration using this if you have a extensive library, and probably no issue if you have just a dozen series or so. The best thing I can say is when you're actually reading a book, there is no issue and the options it has for simply reading/displaying are good and varied enough.

Not bad, not great either. It's difficult to return to the previous menu, could use a bookmark button too. Otherwise it's a good comic reader, just has 2 issues preventing a 5 star review. Would I recommend this reader? Heck yeah. It does exactly what it is supposed to do. And that is allow you to read your favorite comics in a variety of formats.

This is the best overall comic reader now (if your goal is to read comics/manga files you already own). If you want to discover and buy new comics, many publishers have their own app for that. I picked this one because I used the desktop version for years. Unlike that old (but still decent) app, this one is still updated.

I really enjoy this reader. It's quick, lightweight, and has a nice array of options on how to navigate through volumes. Well worth the price. My only suggestion to improve it would be to allow different resize/scaling algorithms to be used. The default one works fine, but I'd like the option to be able to choose options like nearest neighbor, Lanczos, and so on along with softer or sharper settings. Other than that, by far my favorite comic reader.

Ive been a user, and fan, of the free version for years now. And while the ads on that app can ruin the immersion sometimes, more often than not it was only a mild annoyance. But 6-ish dollars for the complete version? Sign me up! Purchased it a few days ago and havent regretted it since, nor plan on doing so either. Love the product.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you ðŸ™

scraped_reviews.content: This is by far the best comic reader on the play store. Its layout is simple and it gets the job done. I gladly paid for the premium version. I only wish the reader had some widgets and could show number of comis in a series with a more prominent color flag. Also, when I sort by series and I have one book available in the series it shows as its own folder instead of taking me right into the single book I have when I click to read. These are just nit picks and this app is really great

Really nice organization and navigation. Only issue that could just be me; accessing my home screen buttion and expand the notification bar usually shifts the page due to the similar touch commands. Seriously, grav this application for reading comics; tis crisp. Edit: note this is in portrate only, landscape is good. I'd recommend a very small "marging" as a solution. Thank you for the response.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: I will fix that, thanks!

scraped_reviews.content: I very rarely pay for apps, I usually find a free one to use instead. I ended up with like 4 different comic book reader apps because they all had different features I wanted. This app does it all and I was able to delete the others. No complaints here, very happy with it so far, worth the money if you ask me.

Edit: After speaking with the dev, the issue was the way ChromeOS handles external storage, something which likely changed recently. Once the setting was toggled the external storage was visible to access my comics. ------ The new release (5/30/2022) breaks access to external storage such as SD cards and USB sticks. It only reads the internal storage, even if you enter the full path of a directory on the external storage.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: I replied a second time, please check your spam box.

scraped_reviews.content: this app is designed for any kind of user. Easy navigation, the ability to set the direction you swipe for the next page and other useful features make this a must own for any comic fan. However one thing is missing, there's no search, which would be helpful in reading one of those 1200 page omnibus's. However I'm no expert on app design and admit that the lack of search functions could be the result of some technical issue I know nothing about. Either way the app gets an a. Highly Recommended
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you, comics are images only, you can't search for text. You can specify your request by contacting me at contact@cdisplayex.com

scraped_reviews.content: It's a very powerful and user-friendly comic reader, but when I use fit-width in the landscape, the transition animations ( in the same page ) cannot be turned off, they leave severe ghosting when used on e-ink readers. I hope there will be an option to turn them off. Many thanks to the author for their quick reply within hours.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, transitions can be disabled in the settings. Disable the two options documented here: https://www.cdisplayex.com/mobile/settings/#page-transitions

scraped_reviews.content: Really nice comic reader. moved to this from now defunct comicrack, and I'm really happy. Would like an reader option, to be able to switch off animations when moving page. plus also a way to switch off ,oving page when you swipe up/down. But these are small niggles to an excellent app. but as I'm asking. how about a way to organise comics as well? ðŸ˜€
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks, please check documentation
https://www.cdisplayex.com/mobile/reader/#page-transitions
https://www.cdisplayex.com/mobile/settings/#page-transitions

scraped_reviews.content: Absolute gem of an app. Moving from IOS to android, I thought comixology was good. This is even better. Shame that there aren't a feature to organise and arrange comics the way we want. My workaround was to rename the comics and then upload it to the phone. Tedious but once you get it right, you got your comics organised just the way you want it.

Brilliant app; a quick glance around the interface and the other app I'd been using for decades was gone without a second thought; I'm only sorry it took me so long to realise this even existed. Fantastic dev too â€” the only issue I had was sorted in a few hours (it was something I missed in the settings). Thanks so much!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, disable immersive mode in the reader settings; this should make it easier for you to exit the application.

scraped_reviews.content: Great app for comics! I have used the free one for about half a year; I saved up my Google Play Rewards and purchased this one: it's just like the lite one, just without the ads plus some more features; if you downloaded comics to your device, give this app a try, it will be a great experience!

I've tried a few apps here, and so far, this is the best comic reader app in the Play Store for android. The only thing missing is a Guided Panel view mode where you can view comics by panels like in the Kindle app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, starting guide and documentation is available here: https://www.cdisplayex.com/mobile/quickstart/

scraped_reviews.content: Update: Developer almost immediately answered with a solution and updated the app the next day. Thanks. Works great. Old: Can't finish the introduction to the app. The skip and finish buttons from the app are to low and covered by the displayed phone buttons on the screen (changing app, closing app + back) - Galaxy A53
scraped_reviews.replyContent: I sincerely apologize for this bug. An urgent update has just been released (1.3.90) and fixes this issue.

scraped_reviews.content: great so far. my small amount of research and user reviews from various sources led me to this app. haven't used/ explored most of what the app can do quite yet so leaving room to add a extra star later

Reading experience is awesome. The only thing I would appreciate is the option to enable slide only for horizont and not vertical since I very often move to the next page when I want to show system controls. But still clear 5*!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, the button at the bottom left of the reading interface allows you to select this behavior. I recommend reading the documentation about it: https://www.cdisplayex.com/mobile/reader/#page-transitions

scraped_reviews.content: Reading experience is excellent and can be customised to suit your preferences. UI could use some work, I'd particularly appreciate an option to exit the app from immersive view without having to swipe the edge.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks! you can assign the action of exiting the view to an area of the screen with a simple tap or long press. Go to the settings at the bottom. In addition, non-immersive mode now supports edge-to-edge display, so I think swiping will be less annoying in this mode.

scraped_reviews.content: An amazing comic reading app. Best I've used on my tablet. I just wish it read epub files, but that's a minor grievance.
bought it after loving the free version, obviously better, as perfect as it gets. no other comic reader compares.
Haven't had any second doubts to pay. I also use it on my pc as well. Greatest comic reading app you could ask for.
Works perfectly and the price is very competitive, but the UI isn't great.
This is a very good app! I would like you to add a 'Sharpen Image' option if possible. Thank you!

I've tried so many manga readers over the past decade, apart from Tachiyomi that was no longer available, this is the best one I've found. yes the price is a bit steep but it's worth it. even the free one is really great with just a bit of ads on the gui. I hope the Devs can give us S3 integration. I'm using Komga for now and it's working great, but since it needs my server to be running, it's not very efficient. UPDATE: preloading manga uses phone storage, my phone doesn't have big storage
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, there's a dark mode in the premium version, it follows the default system settings. You can adjust the mode in the general settings. Also, you can preload the books you want to read offline, without being connected to Komga. Your phone is compatible with an additional SD card. You will need to change the download folder in the settings.

scraped_reviews.content: This is the best comicbook reader on Android. Fast, mostly easy to use, and has some nice features. Initial setup is a bit complicated, the interface of adding my favorite folders could've been simpler. It's biggest advantage over other apps is the ability to access SD Card on modern Android, other readers either can't do it, or so clunky that not worth using. I have SD Card with 100Gb+ of comics, my tablet won't even fit that much in internal memory, but this reader solves it for me.

CDisplayEx is a simple and easy to use comic reader that supports lots of formats. I like the customizable reading modes and smooth page transitions. The app is great for reading comics without distractions. One thing it doesn't do is let you move files into folders inside the app, so organizing has to be done outside, but overall it's a solid choice!
Great app but a question on certain pages, is it possible to display let's say a double page spread in landscape orientation while keeping single pages in portrait
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, you can have different settings for portrait and landscape modes. When your device is in portrait mode, select single-page mode. Turn your device to landscape mode and select double-page mode. This is the default configuration.

scraped_reviews.content: No issues. Would be nice if it could auto zoom on individual panels. App good
really useful for reading comics, and the options for how to read are vast too.

Sort function didn't work at all. Already click z to a, but nothing happens at all. force close the app still the same. Finally I have money to buy this app! This is the best comic reader. With continuous page, i can read long strip comic like manhua/manhwa/webtoon conveniently. Zoom out is must have feature. With that, i can easily see what's going on with that loooooooong image, lol.

Works fine, no crashes so far. Only mild annoyance: there's no option to tell the app that all the comics in a folder are read right to left so I've got to change it every time I open a Japanese manga. After more than a year, I'm now only using that app to read all my books. It also works very well with large PDFs. I noticed a few crashes when reading big (1+GB) files one after the other. The app recovers fine and gets me back to the book and page that caused the crash and I can go on reading.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Thanks. This option exists. Long press on a folder and open the menu by touching the 3 small dots in the option bar that appears at the bottom.
I think your device is a little short of RAM. Reduce the cache size in the settings to at least 12MP. 10MP if you have 3GB.

scraped_reviews.content: This is the best comic reader and a great app and well worth the price. No ads at all and I use it every day. Smooth scrolling, keeping the art and text in clear focus with tons of options so you can read how you want. Keeps a visual progress tab of what you've read and how much and is easy to show and organize your collection. Only complaint is that I used the free version for ages and the pro version doesn't keep the read/reading progress from the free version, but that's no problem really.

Perfect app for reading comic books. So many options and the assisted panning is really well done. Can't recommend this highly enough. My only complaint is that I can't seem to figure out how to manually order series which may not fit into an alphabetically ordered list. An option to make 'playlists' and manually order that books would resolve this. Otherwise no issues and my go to app for comics.

Believe the hype. I've tried out at least 20 other comic readers for Android, and found all of them lacking some very basic features. CDisplayEx is the only one that is fast and easy and user friendly, similar to the great Chunky comic reader for iOS. If only it would also support .mobi files so that it could be the complete ebook reader, and I could ditch the terrible Kindle app.

Thanks for replying to my previous review, I searched the option for changing the reading direction in the settings, and didn't even notice it was in the comic view itself. One thing I found to be quite annoying though is scrolling from one page to the next. I'd be great if there was an option that would allow to read the comic as if it were one long page, instead of pushing the view on one page or the other. Regardless, this app is still the best comic reader out there that I found, and I really appreciate the quick response
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Well, there is already a button on the reader interface to switch to manga mode. It is the second button on the top righ area, it look look a S. If you have more questions don't hesitate to contact us at contact@cdisplayex.com, conversation is limited here.

scraped_reviews.content: Allows you to browse folders from an external hard drive, instead of having to 'import' them like 99% of other comic readers. It's literally just plug and play. Extremely useful if you have a large catalogue of comics. Also retains read/unread data after unplugging hard drive and plugging in again later. Only thing I would want added to the features list is the ability to add/edit comic metadata. Great app, well worth the money.

I think if you had a feature that let me edit the cover image of whatever I wanna read so i don't have to go through the process of extracting and recompressing just to edit one image just to get everything looking right and aligned this app would be the best. For ex. I got manga that have two sided cover images for the back and front and i don't wanna edit these all the times just to get the front.

Hats off to the best android comic reader. It's simple , easy to use , beautiful, light weight and feature rich.Both for new readers and advance readers. It's very easy to manage your comic book collection and it automatically tells you which comic you should read next from the collection. Loved it :) Can you please add support for mega or nextcloud? Edit: Thank you :)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Mega support has arrived in the latest version.

scraped_reviews.content: best comic and Manga reader ever! so easy to use and friendly super recomented

It's a good app, but i came from iPad using comicglass and that was holy grail. For example, i can't download a complete folder, had to do file by file, what is terrible when you have a huge serie sorted on folders. I know that I can select all, but if there's a folder inside, it won't download anything. One more thing that i miss from comicglass is the light settings, when I read to a darkroom was able to lower the backlight intensity.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, enter the folder, do a long press on one of the files then use the "select all" function in the menu at the bottom right, then use the download button. I will simplify this function in future versions. Brightness is a setting that is part of the general settings of your phone.

scraped_reviews.content: Love it but I really would love to see panel-by-panel guided reading!!
Very great app for reading Manga/Manhwa. Very worth the purchase. Highly recommend
works great, store all my comics on OneDrive and connects to it easily

ETA: I have uninstalled and reinstalled, cleared cache and cookies, restarted my phone, and it will not load past the "I'm in the United States" selection. this is a problem, as I have several hundred dollars in outstanding balance with klarna and would like to make payments without logging into the browser each time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ophelia, we're sorry to hear this. Please try deleting and reinstalling the app to make sure that your device has the latest system update. We also advise clearing your cache and cookies. Please visit and chat with us at www.klarna.com/us/customer-service/ for more help. Thank you.

title: Khan Academy Kids
description:
Make screen time more meaningful with Khan Academy Kidsâ€”the award-winning, educational app for kids ages 2â€“8. Packed with fun, standards-aligned reading games, math games, phonics lessons, and interactive storybooks, the app has helped over 21 million preschool and elementary students learn at home, at school, and on the go. Join Kodi the Bear and friends on exciting educational adventures that spark curiosity, build confidence, and inspire a lifelong love of learning. 

PLAY-BASED READING, MATH & MORE:
From ABC games and phonics practice to counting, addition, and shapes, kids can explore over 5,000 educational games and activities with Kodiâ€™s friends:
â€¢ Ollo the Elephant â€“ phonics and letter sounds
â€¢ Reya the Red Panda â€“ storytime and writing
â€¢ Peck the Hummingbird â€“ numbers and counting
â€¢ Sandy the Dingo â€“ puzzles, memory, and problem-solving

AWARDS AND RECOGNITION:
With more than 180,000 5-star reviews, Khan Academy Kids has won the hearts of families and educators worldwide. 
â€¢ â€œBest kids app EVERâ€
â€¢ â€œItâ€™s 100% free and my kids learn so much!â€
â€¢ â€œIf youâ€™re looking for a HIGH quality app for your kids, this is it!â€

Recognition includes:
â€¢ Common Sense Media â€“ Top Rated Educational App
â€¢ Childrenâ€™s Technology Review â€“ Editorâ€™s Choice
â€¢ Parentsâ€™ Choice â€“ Gold Award Winner
â€¢ Apple App Store â€“ Editorâ€™s Choice

A LIBRARY OF STORYBOOKS AND VIDEOS:
Discover hundreds of kidsâ€™ books and videos for preschool, kindergarten and early elementary.
â€¢ Explore animals, dinosaurs, science, and more with non-fiction books from National Geographic and Bellwether Media. 
â€¢ Choose â€œRead To Meâ€ for read-aloud storybooks in English or Spanish. 
â€¢ Dance and sing-along with videos from Super Simple Songs! 

FROM PRESCHOOL TO 2ND GRADE:
Khan Academy Kids grows with your child, from age 2 through 8 and beyond:
â€¢ Preschool learning games build foundational reading, math, and life skills.
â€¢ Kindergarten activities cover phonics, sight words, writing, and early math.
â€¢ 1st and 2nd grade lessons strengthen reading comprehension, problem-solving, and confidence.

SAFE, TRUSTED, AND ALWAYS FREE:
Created in partnership with the Stanford Graduate School of Education by education experts, aligned with Head Start and Common Core Standards, COPPA-compliant, and 100% freeâ€”no ads, no subscriptions. Khan Academy is a nonprofit with the mission to provide a free, world-class education for anyone, anywhere.

LEARN ANYWHEREâ€”AT HOME, AT SCHOOL, EVEN OFFLINE:
â€¢ At home: Khan Academy Kids is the perfect learning app for families at home. From sleepy mornings to road trips, kids and families love learning with Khan Kids. 
â€¢ For homeschool: Families that homeschool also enjoy our standards-aligned, educational kids games and lessons for kids.
â€¢ At school: In-app Teacher Tools help preschool and elementary school teachers create assignments, track student progress, and make the most of small-group and whole-group learning.
â€¢ On the go: No wifi? No problem! Download books and games for learning on the go. Perfect for car trips, waiting rooms, or cozy mornings at home.

START YOUR LEARNING ADVENTURE TODAY
Download Khan Academy Kids and watch your child discover, play, and grow. 

JOIN OUR COMMUNITIES FOR FAMILIES AND TEACHERS
Follow @khankids on Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube. 

KHAN ACADEMY:
Khan Academy is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization with the mission to provide a free, world-class education to anyone, anywhere. Khan Academy Kids was created by early learning experts from Duck Duck Moose who created 22 preschool games and won 22 Parentsâ€™ Choice Awards, 19 Childrenâ€™s Technology Review Awards and a KAPi award for Best Childrenâ€™s App. Khan Academy Kids is 100% free with no ads or subscriptions.

summary: Early learning for kids ages 2-8! Educational games for reading, math, and more!

scraped_reviews.content: This is a great app for toddlers and little ones. No Ads anywhere. And the app is free (thank you)! So I highly recommend the Khan Academy Kids app. The app is very well made and it makes very simple requests that are easy for a little one to follow. Plus I love the reward system. My kiddo loves playing with the bugs, she's very happy to just sit and put them in the container and then drag them back out. Thanks for creating a safe space for my kid to play and learn. :)
scraped_reviews.replyContent: You are so welcome, Erica. Happy continued learning and bug-catching to your little one! ðŸ¦‹

scraped_reviews.content: I downloaded this for my 2 and 4 year olds. They love it! There is so much variety and I never have to buy a new pack of something or tell my kids they can only play on certain unlocked parts because it's all free! My kids love being able to switch between listening to books, watching videos, and playing games. I love that it's all educational, can be tailored to each child's age/level, and that you can link the account to different devices by via login and they can be at the same spot on all devices! Great app!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Excellent. Our team is very happy to hear that your family is enjoying Khan Academy Kids. If you have suggestions at any point, feel free to reach us directly at khankids@khanacademy.org.

scraped_reviews.content: We really like this fun, educational app. However, I have one complaint / request. My child would like to read the library books to themselves, but they have a visual impairment and the text is way too small on our smartphone. There is no option to enlarge the text. They can listen as the books are read to them, but the highlighted text is too small for them to see. Please make this more accessible for visually impaired children.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your feedback about the books, Sarah, and have shared your request with our development team. Thanks for your review!

scraped_reviews.content: Highly recommend! Khan Academy Kids has some cool concepts in here such as under and bigger. The lessons/games are not too short or too long. You can select content by age and if you find it too hard or too easy just adjust the age accordingly. It is really nice to have something to occupy my 4 year old that is interactive and productive. Letters, numbers, math, reading, and theory are all categories you can choose from. They also pull from Super Simple Songs which my son is familiar with so that was a fun surprise for him. Thank you Khan Academy for this really great app!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Theresa! We're glad you're experiencing so much of the content and features in Khan Kids. Thanks for this comprehensive review!

scraped_reviews.content: If you're reading the reviews to determine if you should download, you should. Educational (the fun kind), ad-free, a robust offline section, and free - and my 3yrold loves it more than I hoped. He's singing the songs (which means practicing long vowel sounds in the car) and learning how to work technology (tap and drag, menu, etc.). He loves it. I showed him the app one time and the next day he was asking to play his new game. This will be the go-to for long car rides and I won't have to worry!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Wow! Your review is so fun to read, Amanda. It's delightful to hear that he's learning through singing, and asking to learn more with Khan Kids. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with the app!

scraped_reviews.content: Just wonderful. My daughter is not tech savvy. I have tried to keep her from technology because I wanted her to know how to use her imagination and play with toys. Now that she is 2, she has been curious but clueless. I wanted to have something that teaches her to use a tablet and learn preschool fundamentals as well. I love super simple songs & the way it is implemented in this app is wonderful. I even sent this to friends. The best part is it is free and has no ads. Keep up the awesomeness!

What an amazing app!  I had previously been using Leap Frog Academy with my daughters (ages 3 and 5).  It was a nice service, but cost $7.99  a month.  IMO Khan Academy is better organized, more robust, more engaging, and it's FREE!   It's based on Head Start Early Learning Outcomes and Common Core, and provides a great series of lessons and activities to teach the alphabet, numbers, reading, and logic.  I'm absolutely amazed at the quality of the entire thing and would highly recommend it to anyone with preschool, pre-K, or Kingergarten age children.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Wonderful! Thank you for the review, Matthew!

scraped_reviews.content: Guilt-free game play! My children, 2 and 4, both love this app! They have their own accounts that are tailor-made to their age. There is a mix of book reading, tracing letters, coloring, songs, number practice. As a parent who believes in limiting screen time, I have very little guilt associated with them playing on this app. Even the "points" they earn are used to select gifts to give to the characters! Parents can even see what concepts the child has mastered in an easy format. No complaints!!

Imagine a certain children's learning app with a "Mouse" in the title. Now imagine that awesome app for free. That is Khan Academy. The lessons, games, books, activities and fun never seem to end. They update and add new lessons, books, activities and games frequently and each one is created by teachers to suit the level of your child's abilities. I have already, and will continue to, recommend this app to all my friends and family.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We really appreciate your review and recommendation, Krissanne!

scraped_reviews.content: I watched what my child was doing while playing. My child was curious and engaged with the counting, phonics, and beginning word games. I do not have a background i. Early childhood education and am trying to find educational opportunities at every turn. This plus pbs kids, teaching monster to read, and watching any cartoons/shows in Spanish audio work for us right now.

Great, FREE app! A lot of learning apps claim they're free, but you usually have a ton of non kid friendly ads pop up. This app is ad free, and really, truly free! My 4 year old loves it! I use it as a fun learning app to add on to our "schooling" that I do with her. The characters are cute, the songs fun and educational, and she gets so happy when the mail truck comes and rewards her for her hard work. Amazing app!

Not only is it thoughtfully created and structured, but it is free, AND there are NO adds! I could not ask for more! My daughter loves the learning games, and I love how they vary the teaching. For example, if she is learning the letter sound "a", it will have her work on a but also throw in other letters during the same game so she gets a variety and a well rounded review. I am very grateful for this!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Likewise, we are grateful for your review, Caleb! I have relayed your note to our content team. They'll be pleased to hear that you found our letters, sounds, and words lessons so helpful.

scraped_reviews.content: As much as I love Khan Academy and the lessons in the app, we're not really loving the app itself. I think it would improve the app a lot if there were more options to turn certain sounds off. The sound effects and voices are little repetitive and annoying. Also, every lesson in each section has the same intro and there isn't a way to skip it (that we've found). I think this app is great for younger kids, but I think it could use some improvements for kids older than five.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We value your input and have shared your feedback with our team. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I love Khan Academy and their mission of free, quality education. As a frequent user of it over the years, I was excited, but hesitant to see their app for children. Most other education apps geared toward children are filled with ads or are limited/extremely basic unless you pay. Khan Academy contains none of that. It's filled with fun, interesting games that are age appropriate. My daughter loves the songs and activities. I like that you can select different levels based on their age, and it's easy enough for her to navigate (she's two, almost three) while my hands are busy doing her hair. Thank you, Khan Academy!

Best learning app for children I've found!! My children love it! We love all the books! The kids love being able to choose content from the "library." The learning path is creatively designed. (: The kids love the "gifts"! (: I'm happy we can turn the music off - some apps don't let you mute the music, which can become distracting when trying to learn. The interface is very intuitive! The best part - it's free! My only wish would be for the learning path difficulty to be more customizable. (:
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing your feedback on Khan Academy Kids, Britainy! Here is additional information on the Learning Path: https://khankids.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360041615571-How-does-the-learning-level-adjust-and-how-do-I-view-my-child-s-progress-. Feel free to reach out to khankids@khanacademy.org with any questions or suggestions.

scraped_reviews.content: I love that this app is free. I wish that there were more features making it easier to use for a class, such as being able to move students from one class to the other, being able to assign multiple lessons at one time. It's great that there are more advanced phonics lessons.It would be helpful if the books had their lexical or guided reading level to make them eaiser to assign. Also - would be nice to have it available on windows devices.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Jaidaly, we appreciate your feedback and have shared your suggestions with our team. Some Windows 11 devices are now supported, and reading levels are described in this article: https://khankids.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360014856151. We'd be happy to provide you with more information. Our team can be reached at khankids@khanacademy.org.

scraped_reviews.content: This is by far our favorite app for our two year old. She loves it and had learned so much from it. There are no problems with pop ups, ads, or "optional in game buying". She's learned all of her alphabet, most of her numbers (in order, no less!) and loves the songs. We have this app on every device we open and are so happy to support open education.

Wonderful app! It's actually free, and just what I was looking for! The content is educational and entertaining, but not overly stimulating like most of the bright, noisy slot-machine like games available for kids. My daughter goes right to and enjoys playing the songs over and over. She's about 16 mo and does fine with the 2 year lowest age setting. Only complaint is I wish they would use a dragging motion to do things like put the hat on the bear, as clicking it is less fun and confuses her.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Madison, we are happy that your daughter enjoys playing the songs in the app! We have noted your suggestion for our team. Thank you for your review!

scraped_reviews.content: Great educational app. Started with my 2 year old. The content is advancing as he is learning more and is able to do more.  I love how it teaches more than just letters/reading and math - it teaches about weather and feelings, and even more. We are able to incorporate things from the app into our discussions of every day life, which helps him make connections more easily. And no ads or paid stuff! Perfect for a little kid who likes to tap everything to see what happens!

The graphics and voices are great and most of the games are as well. It's wonderful this app is free. But the main flaw is that there isn't a way for parents to customize it so that the child doesn't just skip to the easy bits and the videos with little or no educational value. Khan, please enable a 'locked' feature so the kids can't just back up to the home screen and access the full library or navigate backwards to the not-challenging content.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Joel! Understood. We've noted your feedback for our development team. Thanks for letting us know!

scraped_reviews.content: The best free app anyone could get! My daughters love it. They have learned so much! And the learning is never ending. New stuff gets added for different seasons. There are lots of levels of learning like pre-k, 1st grade, ect. The characters are so fun. I love it because they get kids to interact with it. "Lets get our bodies moving" "waddle like the penguins do". It is very kid friendly. No bad content. The kahn academy team is amazing at what they put together in this app. I'm very impressed!

Pros: This is a great resource, filled with excellent learning activities that the kids love. Highly recommended! Cons: 1) Often we have to restart to use the app. Don't know if this is a problem on the Chromebook side or KAK app side. 2) As a teacher, it is frustrating to have to use the app to assign activities. I would appreciate a web interface on my computer. 3) Finally, it would be very helpful to have a co-teachers option, or another way for teachers to share the same group of students.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We value your input and have noted your suggestions for our education team. For device support, we are available to help investigate the app's performance at khankids@khanacademy.org. Teacher features are described here: https://khankids.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360046489851 including more options (like co-teaching) for schools with Clever.

scraped_reviews.content: Best Toddler App on any device. I have this app on an andriod phone and a 7" Amazon Tablet. IT WORKS, so I can give the table to my little and they can search out the countless activities to play, draw, and listnen to books. It would be nice for travel if the app would still work without internet by maybe at letting in app downloads of some books, songs, or activities for offline use. For Visual empaired parents, make option for the menu screen FONT OR PICTURE LARGER.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Wendy. The "Kodi's Suitcase" and Create tabs in the app's Library should work offline: https://khankids.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360029139531-Learn-on-the-go-with-offline-content-in-Khan-Academy-Kids. In addition, we have shared your request for font adjustments with our content team. Thanks for your feedback and review.

scraped_reviews.content: Such a wonderful app for kids to learn and play. No ads. Can assign homework and watch them grow. Helps with counting, letters, reading, sounds, shapes, sizes, complex thinking, reasoning. Such a wonderful app and great way for our children to learn and have fun doing it! Best app so far and I like it way better than the ABC Mouse I just paid for.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're thrilled to read your review! Thanks for taking the time to provide such positive feedback, Ashley!

scraped_reviews.content: This is better than all 4 of the paid for school apps we have tried.   The user interface is easy or the kid to understand.  The material is age appropriate.  Mostly the kid likes it more than all her other learning tools.  A big plus is she is not clicking on ads and installing weird apps all the time.  This app seems to e making the world a better place.

Found this app as I searched for an ABC program for my little one. This has been far greater than any of those in regards to its content, it has no ads, and its free. It is enjoyable and it keeps his attention far greater than those other apps. Honestly, when the game ads interrupt, he prefers to go to that then stay on task. Thanks Khan Academy for all you do!

This is a really great app! It is educational but focusing also on feelings. My kid likes the gentle feedback for when they are doing something wrong and the little rewards for when they are doing right. My spouse asked if it was a free app because it is really well done. I like also the library that contains books that are narrated but without video content I see in other read aloud books. And there are also some little activities for books, so it's not a passive content. Only downside: my kid would love more printables to color.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing your experience using our app, we're glad you're enjoying it! Thank you for your feedback about the printables, we've noted your input.

scraped_reviews.content: I love this app! I have a preschool daughter, and have found the content to be engaging and age appropriate. The time she spends on the app is limited, as she is still very young. On days where we are not paying attention to the clock, we discovered that the app has a built in "stop and move your body" portion and it's great! Truly a great, age appropriate, educational app that does NOT have ads! I would pay for this,  but so grateful that it is free!

As a teacher, I ADORE this app! My pre-k students use khan kids in our classroom every morning. It has great age-appropriate, interactive activities. You can assign lessons to different classes or individual students so everyone can learn at their own pace. They have math, reading writing, and logic skills, plus an amazing selection of fiction and non-fiction books. And it's FREE! Can't be beat!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Wonderful to hear you are using so many of the teacher features in the app, Polly. Thank you for your kind review!

scraped_reviews.content: I've tried tons of these "Kids" apps and games, and this one is the best by far. My 3 year old always asks for this one first, and not only has a good time, but develops some skills without even realizing it. There are some interactions that can be improved, but overall I'm blown away by the thought and quality. The voice acting and character animations are excellent! Been telling all my friends with kids about it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your review, Reony, and especially your referral to friends. It's great to hear that your 3-year-old is enjoying Khan Kids!

scraped_reviews.content: My daughter has been playing this game since she was a little over 1 Â½. There is a wide range of learning material by subject including social/emotional and by age. And the guided lessons are geared by the child's age and progress. She has been able to easily navigate the app and it allows for her to find other activities (songs, stories, etc) outside of the main learning page. And if she gets bored with or can't figure out a particular lesson she is allowed to leave and try something else.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jeryka, we're so pleased to read that your daughter enjoys learning with us. Thank you for taking time to leave us a kind review!

scraped_reviews.content: Good idea, could use fixes. When it works, my 4 year old loves it. The library feature is a favorite of his, especially since he can have the books read to him. However, there are some times where the app seems to stop working, and won't allow any way out if a game or activity without getting out of the app completely and restarting it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Brooke. We are really sorry for the trouble and we appreciate you bringing this issue to our attention. Please write to us at khankids@khanacademy.org if you continue to have this issue.

scraped_reviews.content: Love this app for my daughter, who is almost 6! I especially love that it was free and has no ads. The app is well thought out, engaging, fun, and has cute characters. The Grandmas wanted to buy another popular learning app that is advertised frequently on Nick Jr., but I told them not to bother because I had Khan Academy Kids. Incidentally, my daughter is at goal or above goal for reading and comprehension for her age group (kindergarten), and we still have one more trimester to go!

We love this app! It's one of my son's favorite things to do on his new tablet. He calls it his "learning". I do wish you could track progress through the regular Khan Academy (as he has an account there), and there's definitely a need for more to do offline. We like to use this in the car or while we are out for very long periods of time, but he is getting bored with the small bits he can do offline. Otherwise, this is a really great app, overall.

So far so good. We've only had the app for a few weeks and my three year old is very intrigued. She loves the library section because she likes to pick her own books. She can also navigate the app very well by herself (big plus). No ads (bigger plus), I can safely leave it in her hands. I like the quick learning segments. It is a fun way to learn for a few minutes or longer quiet times.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: It's great to hear that your daughter enjoys the library books in Khan Kids, Jeri. Thanks for taking the time to let us know!

scraped_reviews.content: Fun and Educational! I prefer this app to ABC Mouse. My daughter spends so much time on ABC mouse spending her tickets and playing with the "stuff" she bought she doesn't do learning games. This app just has one learning activity after another, and it's free! Plus it doesn't have any adds, something most free apps has. Absolutely love it!

Invaluable resource. We use it as part of our homeschool curriculum, but I would use it even if we didn't! They think it's a video game- very interactive and fun! There's stuff for every age. A 3 year old can be taught gross and fine motor movements, sorting, technological skills and numbers/letters, etc. A 6 year old can strengthen reading comprehension, number sense, logical reasoning and more. Note: It is easier on the larger tablet screen for young children. 100% FREE- NO ADS/SUBSCRIPTIONS
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're so delighted to read your review, Aubrae. Thank you so much!

scraped_reviews.content: I love this for my almost 4 year old because it is educational. I feel like my child is behind reading since her preschool doesn't really emphasize on academics yet. It is interactive with videos clips, they have singing, tracing, sounding letters, and coloring. She is learning while playing a game. This app is teaching her a little math like which is more and counting. For a free app without ads, this is beyond my expectations. I just wish there's a way to play with it without wifi/data.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for your review, Hoang. We value your input! Stay tuned for future app updates which will provide more content and feature options.

scraped_reviews.content: Khan Academy Kids is an amazing platform for the students in my class to work on both math and reading skills at their own pace. It is highly engaging and motivational for the kids to want to continue to come back each day. As a teacher, I can easily view reports to see what my students have accomplished and what skills still need more practice. It is very easy for teachers to set up and easy for students to access. It's a "just right for everybody" program!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for letting us know what you think about our new progress reports for teachers. It's wonderful to hear that you're using Khan Kids with your students, Lynne!

scraped_reviews.content: This is the best educational app for toddlers that I've found. Two suggestions: When the child takes too long to answer a question properly give a hint rather than letting the ap sit forever. Also, please give an option when launched that will eliminate ads. Right now it's perfect. With ads upon launch it could ruin the experience for toddlers. I'll be willing to pay for that for sure. Great work, y'all! We really appreciate it!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate your comments and review. The good news is that Khan Academy Kids will remain completely free with no ads, even when launched out of beta. We hope you continue to enjoy it!

scraped_reviews.content: Have this on Both kids' tablets from Christmas. My son started picking up lessons faster than his older sister!!! scraped_reviews.content: This app is truly unique! And amazing. 1. It's free! That's highly unusual today. scraped_reviews.content: A fun, free, age appropriate educational app. Different content delivery and concepts based on age. They do have lots of read aloud/along books in app. Kids enjoy the little prizes. I limit the use to a number of lessons and books depending on which child for what reward. I'm a fan.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for your review. Great to know your a fan! If you ever have questions or suggestions, we can be reached at khankids@khanacademy.org.

scraped_reviews.content: It's very great for my toddler! She just turned 2 and I was looking for some way to slowly integrate technology into her life. I find these games to be great substitutes for TV time. Some are a little advanced for her right now, but she seems to have fun anyways! There is a little lag time with some of the games too, but the tablet we are using is pretty old, so it could be either the app or the tablet! So far I am pretty impressed by this!

I downloaded this app because my son was in need of learning new things and more mental stimulation. He, like all little kids, is a sponge. I was doing my best with the things we had at home, but it wasn't enough. He has blossomed since using this app. He's finding numbers wherever we go, he's learned most of his letters, and his drawings are starting to be discernible. As an educator, I am impressed with Khan Academy's appreciation of developmental needs and abilities. I highly recommend Khan Academy.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing your experience using our app, we're so happy to read your son is learning with us! We appreciate your review, thanks for recommending us.

scraped_reviews.content: Completely free educational learning for grades Pre-K - 1st grade, altho my 2nd grade child still loves it. My children love it as well as the rewards they earn. This app truly makes learning fun. A lot of materials are available offline as well which is great if you have slow or no internet like we do. This app has helped us through remote learning as well as keeping up on old material during summer break or preparing for the next grade. Easy to navigate and play. No ad's or in app purchases.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Gabbie, we're so glad to know your children enjoy learning with our app! Thank you for your kind review and for sharing your experience with our app. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: East to follow for my for year old, and aligns with common core standards. we're at abc mouse family, but i have to say, this has a much simpler interface. although I am with my son during abc mouse time, I would honestly feel more comfortable leaving his side for this app. the graphics are bubblier, if that makes sense, and the characters speak directly to the child. it's a great addition to our learning tools.

This app is pretty amazing and my grandbaby at 2 years old (with a little help) is learning positional words, opposites, comparisons, etc. I was a teacher for 30 years and in the last years of teaching I was always on the lookout for an engaging and educational "game" that would keep my students' interest. This would have been it and I wish I found it sooner!

This is the absolute best kids' app! I have downloaded other apps for my 2.5 year old before and deleted them because they are either boring, too many ads, inappropriate ads, or just not really beneficial to him. He loves the video library where he can just pick a topic and watch short videos. He's learning so much. He has twice daily breathing treatments, so we have to have screen time during them. This app makes me feel better about his time in front of the screen.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Danika, we're thrilled to know your son is learning with us! Thank you for your kind words.

title: Business Empire: RichMan
description: Business Empire: RichMan is more than just a passive business game simulation where players make investments and watch their earnings grow. It's an interactive online or offline business game simulator that allows players to make strategic business decisions and take calculated risks to build their business empire. Install Business Empire: RichMan and discover a variety of options to build your empire and reach new heights of success. You can choose to open businesses in six different categories, including retail stores, restaurants, and banks. With the ability to hire employees and make strategic decisions, you can grow your businesses and increase profits. For those of you who prefer to invest in the stock market, Business Empire: RichMan allows players to buy virtual shares in famous companies and monitor their investments to maximize their virtual earnings. Alternatively, players can invest in real estate in the most elite areas of the world, generating passive income and increasing their net worth. Other than buy and sell stocks, players are welcome to also invest in cryptocurrencies. Luxury items are also available for purchase in the game, including high-end vehicles and private jets. With the ability to expand your own fleet and hangar, you can travel in style and enhance your status and prestige. Overall, Business Empire: RichMan is a highly interactive game that provides players with a realistic and engaging business management experience. Whether you want to open your own business - a store or a bank, become an investor, or purchase luxury items, Business Empire: RichMan has something for everyone. The simulation game's immersive and interactive gameplay provides endless possibilities for players like you to build your empire and become a true RichMan.

For those of you who prefer to invest in the stock market, Business Empire: RichMan allows players to buy virtual shares in famous companies and monitor their investments to maximize their virtual earnings. Luxury items are also available for purchase in the game, including high-end vehicles and private jets. With the ability to expand your own fleet and hangar, you can travel in style and enhance your status and prestige.

Whether you want to open your own business - a store or a bank, become an investor, or purchase luxury items, Business Empire: RichMan has something for everyone. summary: Step into the world of tycoon simulator games and seal profitable business deals

But really the biggest thing is fixing the navigation bar stuff.
